intro: Kyllinga planiculmis var. mucronata, commonly known as the broadleaf spikerush, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces spikes of small, white or pinkish flowers. It thrives in wet or moist soils, often found in marshy areas or along waterways. Its botanical structure is characterized by a rhizomatous root system and a compact, upright growth habit.
